Reviews.Title: “The only reason to stay here is that the location is good”
Reviews.Author: rugosarose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gates was a disappointing stay when I attended ITB in March. It was very expensive-199 euros(for two nights of my stay, lower for others) for a very basic (no alarm clock) but large room. For example, I had to ask for soap in the shower since the dispenser was empty. The Internet was so slow that I could only look at emails, not respond or even get on a web site. The Internet did not work at all for a day and a half. I only made the front desk staff nervous when I asked them when it would work. In the room, the curtains were very dirty and needed to be rehung as parts were off the hook. My bathroom sink dripped from a loose fitting and did not hold water for rinsing underwear. I hurt my foot and needed ice; the front desk sent my son to the gas station. There is not any hotwater for tea or coffee available. Now for the bright side, Frau Rosenbergenr was very helpful with boarding passes and check out and the hotel is located next to the Tiergarten and close to different train lines. It would be a good budget hotel but was the worst value I have every had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tommytee23
Reviews.Content: Semi-grand arrival, large glass entrance canopy. Staff don't entertain small talk but like all Germans will only talk to 'englanders' if totally necessary. Sometimes a good thing. 2 great venues within walking distance, Mar Y Sol for superb tapas and even better staff.. Stephanie was an absolute star. Just round the corner is the A-trane, funk soul and jazz (depending on whose playing) excellent night. Should be about 13 euros for a taxi in to the centre. Good coffee shop at the bottome of the road with good deli and street tables, guy with the bald head and the beard makes the best coffee.. Well worth it. On the whole a little quiet, but steady flow of peeps and not too far from the centre, wherever that is!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious room, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: xc85
Reviews.Content: I must say this is the best hotel i've ever stayed in my Eurotrip this year! The location is near the metro station Estern Platz. From airpot Tegel can just take the X9 bus that cost a mere 2.30 euro. The hotel staffs are very friendly n helpful. I had problem with opening my room door. Quite tricky for a non-european like me. The staff came together with me to my room to teach me how to open the door. They gave me free map and wireless is available in the whole hotel! Room is superb, clean, spacious and hv cable LAN if u need to connect to your laptop. A very good value for money! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a Christmas present weekend away. Fantastic value in a great city. It is situated in a quiet area of Berlin, within easy reach of the Ubahn and easy walk to the Tiergarden and KuDam. The staff were friendly, rooms very spacious, clean, with a seating area, fridge and comfortable bed. The bathroom was great with a really good shower and plenty of space. There were many restaurants and bars in the area. The whole experience was brilliant. The people we met were friendly and helpful, the hotel was superb especially for the price we paid to stay 3 nights and the city was amazing. I just wish we could have stayed longer and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but good”
Reviews.Author: Bjam F
Reviews.Content: We booked an incredibly cheap room to visit friends just after new year. Given how cheap it was (<20euro each) I was skeptical. But it was a good, hotel. Great shower, simple accessible room. There was only two pillows (one each) and no others in the room - not too much trouble to ask for more though. Good TV and fridge in the room - Plus nice mints on the bed (a very nice touch given the price!) - The room key was an actual key, (havent had one of them for years!) Receptionist was only a temp but very friendly and helpful. We had a smaller room at the back - accessed via the courtyard on the ground floor. Location was okay for East Berlin, I still generally perfer the west but it was a nice quiet location, lacking in some restaurants and ammenities but okay. Close to zoo gartens and good transport all round really. Wouldnt want to stay any longer than a couple of nights but it suited us perfectly. Cheap, cheerful, clean, - what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great room”
Reviews.Author: Blaetzle
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I have only spent one night there... But the service was great, the breakfast was very good and the room was unbelievable. The washromm was very large and clean. Also the rest of the room was above average big and also very clean. Net time, when I stay in Berlin, I'll book my room at the Gates Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable stay...”
Reviews.Author: pfmTorino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at gates novum in berlin for 4 nights around 2012 new year's eve; we were five and they offered us the chance to book a big room with 5 beds. Well...we had a very good stay at cheap prize. The hotel is clean, the staff is great and helpful. Cleaniness is good. The location is very close to the underground (ernst reuter platz station) that can get you everywhere in berlin; on the same square, you can find the bus to tegel airport (X9 line), that you get in 20 minutes. Wifi connection is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gates Novum”
Reviews.Author: Nicola J
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great location for sightseeing, easy access to the U and S trains for sightseeing. Excellant restaurants in surrounding area, for breakfast we went to the Giro Coffee Bar just right out of the hotel, staff were really friendly with map reading and fantastic coffee and fresh croissants. Would definately stay here again, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: jzeb
Reviews.Content: Easily the best hotel in Berlin at this price. We stayed there for 02 nights @ EUR 50 per night. without breakfast. The service is excellent. They even offered free coffee as a gift for booking online. The room was very spacious and clean. Very large washroom. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient. The location is not too bad as well. It is a 10 mins walk to the nearest station, which is just one stop to "Zoologischer Garten" which is the city center. I would love to stay here again and would definitively recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Free bicycles!”
Reviews.Author: sashazykov
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good, only 10 minutes from Tiergarten and near the savegnyplatz, where you can find many cafes and restaurants. Free bicycles for residents! Unfortunately, most of them have some slight problems, and need to be repaired, but you can use them anyway. The internet is very slow, and I have some problems with registration in the network. I have found good breakfasts in cafe Grolman at Grolmanstr. in 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in a charming neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Michele096
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located with good restaurants at a walking distance and the main boulevard June 17th is within a short walk. The U-Bahn ( subway ) is right around the corner. Althought the rooms are spacious and clean there is no water provided and no fitness room in the hotel .The breakfast buffet is average and lacks creativity! There are very little fresh fruits provided. The outdoor court is a nive relaxing area. Personnel is attentive and helpfull.There is no air conditionning so think twice during warm summer days and nights!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special. Very hot rooms, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The room was 24 Celsius while it was 15 outside, no way to get it in a reasonable range. Tying to keep the windiws open is fine, but hat gets you mosquitos and a lot of noise, so not an option for a good nigh sleep. The breakfast buffet is poorly equipped, just one type of rolls, cheap 'wurst' and only soem dry scrambled eggs besid a few cooked ones. Coffee is not overly tasty, tables in the breakfast room are so small that the coffe cup cannot stand besides your table...there are other hotels in the area like tyhe adrema that offer wayyy better services at comparable rates. Bottom .ine, I do not recommend this hotel and would not consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Steve O
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights, good value for money with and a free internet access provided on a clunky but adequate pc in room. In a very safe area of a very safe city it's easy to strike out to the more lively areas of Berlin although good food is available locally in Savignyplatz a coupld of minutes walk away. Staff were typically courteous and efficient, and although the photos make the place look a little more grand and spacious than it is in reality, I would happily recommend this hotel to other travellers as a base to explore the amazing Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nellie3_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a 5 day visit to Berlin and chose it for a couple of reasons, namely its location and also the fact that it advertised full internet access in all 104 rooms which would allow us to conduct small parts of our business whilst there. We found our room on the ground floor to be small but very quiet and extremely comfortable. We did however discover that we did not have a computer in the room as we had been advised would be the case when we contacted the hotel to confirm the booking 3 days prior to departure. We further discovered that the wi-fi access can be temperamental which was occasionally frustrating. We would also however point out that having established locations for 2 internet cafes approx 15 mins walk from the hotel, we subsequently realised that there were a further 2 internet cafes literally next door! The ease of travel to the hotel was wonderful - the train station is a 5 minute walk from Schonefeld Airport and the express train runs very regularly for 3 euros per person (ABC ticket). You take the train to the Zoologische Garten station and then either walk the 10 minutes to the hotel or take the underground to Ernst Reuter Platz which is one stop away. The hotel is then just around the corner. We would certainly go back to the Gates Hotel for its peace and quite, easy access to transport to all the sights in Berlin and for the wonderful breakfast they provide (not to be missed!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: henryg_1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 3 minutes from the nearest U-Bahn, which in the pouring rain was a blessing. Our room was nice, larger than expected, and very clean. Free bikes, which we would have used much more had the weather permitted. The (free) internet, wi-fi or cable, was effectively unusable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great solid point in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Limpjohansson
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin & wasn´t sure about the area or the hotel. We got really suprised as this hotel was amazing. Nice, clean & big rooms (Comfort room) with nice standards. Comfy bed, big flatscreen TV, laptop & a nice bathroom. As my girlfriend has celiaki and need glutenfree food we decided that is was necessery with breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was great & fresh. A small but perfect selection of food. And they were very helpful with glutenfree bread and also if we had any questions they were happy to help. The staff in the reception were also great, helpful and kind! About the area its close to great resturants, 5 minute walk to the big shopping street and about 10 minute to Berlin Zoo! A great place to stay at for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jimo1981
Reviews.Content: We really loved the location and the free bikes.Very clean and peacefull hotel.The only complain is that the staff should be more helpfull and polite.One of the male staff in the front desk was definitely unwilling to help us and didn't have any manners at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JRDNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself for two nights following a business trip. I switched locations from my prior hotel in a suburb of Berlin, which ended up being a very good decision. This hotel is close to the zoo station and walkable with a small amount of luggage. As a solo female traveler, I found the hotel to be in a very safe location. I stayed in room 215, which had a beautiful balcony that looked over the street. The rooms are on the small side but were very clean and had everything I needed. The breakfast was very good although the servers were overwhelmed when I arrived (Saturday morning around 10 am) and it was tough to get coffee. But there is a great cappucino/latte/espresso machine if you don't want to wait for the servers to bring you a pot of coffee. The front desk staff was helpful and efficient, particularly the man who worked the late shift. I really enjoyed the free internet and free bikes -- which were really the only two perks I was looking for as a solo leisure traveler. One word of warning about the bikes, though: the hotel will run out of them over a sunny weekend, but it appears you can reserve them in advance. I did not think of this and I wasn't able to get one at first. Luckily I came back Saturday midday to drop off some purchases, and one bike had become free. I took the bike from about 3 pm until 1 am the next morning and rode around Berlin (which is incredibly bike-friendly compared to any city in the US). It's a great way to see the city. The bikes are basic but are all that you need to ride around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: GDS_10
Reviews.Content: I've staid here twice and keep coming back. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable and clean. Great neighborhood, and for Berlin this is a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: december_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel can offer a transport ticket for a small cost which will save money if one is in Berlin for several days and not intending to travel to zone 3.The hotel serves an excellent breakfast. Its location means that many good restaurants and bars are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible personal at the Gates hotel”
Reviews.Author: mer-en-rio
Reviews.Content: I was at the Gates hotel for 3 nights. I went ther ebecause my laptop didn´t work any more and I needed a PC all the time next to me. The PC at the room they gave to me didn´t work. I asked at the entrance, at around 11 AM if they could fixed. They told me they will. I returned to the hotel at 10 PM and the computer wasn´t fixed. So, the solution they gave to me was to change to another room. After that, another day, I asked one morning the person at the entrance how to arrive to the Ethnological museum. He sent to me to a completely different place, very far away from everywhere. I only had 2 1/2 days in Berlin, and this boy made me loose 4 hours looking for a museum that was in a completely different side of Berlin. Conclusion: a good space with a VERY BAD persona-people at the entrance. Very bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gates Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BreconGlesni
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful hotel Free internet with computer in room Fantastic service from staff-my son wanted bacon for breakfast and they cooked it especially for him Lovely large rooms with comfortable beds and large windows which opened Good value Discounted Berlin travel tickets for sale in reception Cons: None Will stay here again when we return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: daha_no1
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, really friendly staff, free bikes to use 24hours of the day, breakfast spread is amazing and good quality, free wifi to use on your iphone, rooms clean and tidy and good location - not the closest hotel for going out to clubs and bars in East Berlin but I would go back any day

Reviews.Title: “A mix of old with new - great character in a great area”
Reviews.Author: TeamUnch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an older building in West Berlin and has lots of character with enormous windows that open to a courtyard and high ceilings. But it also has been updated with new furnishings, including a very ample sized closet/wardrobe area, a newly updated and clean bathroom, and comfortable beds. The neighbourhood still has a "community" feel to it as it has not become gentrified like some areas of Berlin and is genuinely pretty with old trees lining the streets and lovely boutique stores and cafes all around, not to mention only 5-10 minutes from Ku-damm, a main shopping district. The hotel is located very close to a U-bahn stop and is also on the X9 Express bus straight from the airport so was easy to get to. The free use of a bike was a fanastic way to tour the city on my own and not have to worry about transit maps, timing, etc. The service was really friendly, far friendlier than other places I have stayed in Berlin and Frankfurt before. Over the 4 days here, I took advantage of ordering in room service and asking for bathrobe (not included automatically, but free upon request) and ironing board and iron (again free upon request) and all of these requests were met with attentive and friendly service. It is worth noting that the desk area not only included free wireless, but it also had a desktop, which was useful for work, and certainly a rare addition to a hotel room! Breakfast each morning seemed standard to most buffet breakfasts I have seen in Western Europe - breads, cheeses, lox, yogourt, eggs, and sweets/pastries. Always filling and actually fairly good quality. All in all, I was really content here!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Muzakhater
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 3rd time in 3 years in January. This hotel has a great location in walking distance of Zoo station, the KuDamm and several of my favourite shops (Manufactum, Mientus, the high fashion end of the KuDamm...) but is quiet, not in the least snobby and -by Berlin standards- the staff are superbly trained and generally actually friendly. This isn't the cheapest hotel I have stayed in in Berlin, but it is by a (very) long shot the best value. The rooms are varied but clean and decently appointed with a good bathroom. This time I had a room at the front which was much bigger than the ones in the rear part. It was minus 14C outside, but the room was cosy without being overheated. Good breakfast buffet with superb fresh bread from the Manufactum deli round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “great location for central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Bkbob54
Reviews.Content: gates hotel was good value for money ,very clean ,excellent breakfastsand above all located just a 10 min stroll in to berlin centre surrounded by good bars and restaurants on all the side streets will definately go there again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gates Berlin nice memories”
Reviews.Author: Sherif963
Reviews.Content: free internet and PC in your room, nice facilities, Bicycle rent and transportatiaon tickets

Reviews.Title: “Good value, generally fine, but no air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: First the negative, and it's a big one. This hotel has no air conditioning. It seems to be an old-style building (whether it's old or not is not so clear), with tall rooms and wide windows, but the air flow is simply not good enough when it's pushing 30 degrees and very humid outside. This led to some very uncomfortable nights during my trip (although it got much better when the weather cooled). In addition, I did not find the beds particularly comfortable, but I'm willing to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt here and blame that on the heat. But, positives! Free wireless Internet that worked perfectly and was really fast. Spotlessly clean bathroom, reasonably spacious and most adequate. Comfortable, spacious room for working. Very good selection at breakfast - excellent selection of hot drinks and pretty good mix of continental things. Staff typically helpful throughout the hotel. The location is good, no more than 5 mins walk to Savignyplatz for the S-Bahn to the centre, and indeed there's plenty of life in the nearby area anyway, with plenty of restaurants. Nothing in Berlin is too far away - you can walk for no more than 10 minutes and find pretty much anything! I would generally recommend this hotel, but with the important caveat about the air conditioning. If that would bother you in the summer, I warn against. Indeed, if I were returning I may try to find another hotel for that very reason. Which is a shame, because otherwise it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: airsupply
Reviews.Content: The Gates Hotel is in a lovely part of Charlottenburg, the up-market shopping hub of Berlin. Close to the City's major attractions and with an excellent choice of restaurants in the neighbourhood. The room we stayed in was adequate and good value for the price - although the bathroom was hideous, grey-tiled with an institutional feel. The "internet hotel" concept seems a bit dated but what a bonus to have free internet access! (I totally resent the usually outrageous charges of the the chain hotels for 'net use). The staff at the Gates were efficient and very friendly, although the tiny lobby and lack of common areas meants there was little "buzz" about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a equally interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: As part of my five day tour of Germany my niece and I stayed at the Gates Hotel in Berlin. The hotel is located what is known as West Berlin primarily what is considered the theater District. The Hotel is centrally located to both the subway system as well as the Bus system all within three blocks, if fact we used public transportation exclusively. If you have not traveled in Europe before get used to the idea that rooms are extremely small but efficient.Thuthfully if all you are using the room for is to sleep all you need to know it the rooms are clean,well kep Their is a multitude of cafes that are open till all hours. I really did not run into an issues with rudeness, in fact for the most part people went out of their way to show there kindness. My best advise is get a day pass every morning for about 6 Euro and you are good to go on all transportation systems. We extensively traveled thru Berlin and the countryside. Well worth the Cost. I have many many more hints that I would be willing ro share if anyone is interested

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dezertas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gates is located in a great section of Berlin. Subway is close by - around the corner and down the street and so is a number of cafes, pasteries, a print/photo shop, book store, a t-shirt/jean store etc etc. If it was a nice day, you could walk to the Zoo Palast, or take the subway one stop. Hotel is very clean, adequate, geared for business person or someone attending a film festival, convention centre or for anyone who needs to stay in touch with the world via internet, or needs to get any information. Buffet was amazing. Great quality of food, big selection, and they changed a few items every day. Dining room, was huge, immaculately clean, and the wait staff were friendly and all spoke English which I was grateful for. Same with front desk staff. Very professional, friendly, English was perfect, and staff were very helpful. Some of them however, mainly the night staff would look at you suspiciously if they never saw you previously. After an exchange of pleasanteries and with your door key in hand, they were fine after that - just be patient with that. Housekeeping was very friendly. If you needed to sleep in t'll noon, you would be left alone . You should always put the do not disturb sign up even though when I was in Bologna, Italy, the staff there didn't seem to respect that sign. Overall nice stay, very clean hotel, spacious, simple decor, nice balcony view, large bathroom, white clean tiles, a girls best friend - a removable shower head with great water pressure and adequate amounts of hot water. Large bathroom mirrors and room for accesories. Ask for towels only if you absolutely need fresh towels.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mixers
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for myself and two business colleagues as we were attending a trade fair in berlin. It was difficult to find rooms as the fair co-incided with the Berlin Film Festival, but I managed just before New Year to reserve 3 "Business' rooms at € 185 each per night. For the price paid, the rooms were very small, shabby and not in great repair - certainly not 4 star quality. When we complained, we were told that this was a normal grade room for the price we paid and that was all they could do. We said that as they were not up to standard we were leaving to find somewhere else (3 nights here would have been horrible). The manager said that there was little he could do and that we would be charged in full as they wouldn't be able to sell the rooms at such short notice - there were probably lots of people roaming around the city desperate for somewhere to stay. He didn't handle the complaint very well and we just left and found somewhere else which was much better. Inflated prices due to trade fair/film festival perhaps, but the room quality remains the same all year round. If you can, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: mssvr
Reviews.Content: Single traveller on business. Stayed 12 nights. On a quiet street with a number of small restaurants nearby. Reasonably priced. One hundred meters walk to U-Bahn (U2) station that is only one stop from Zoological Gardens or 300 meters from S-Bahn near the main shopping street Kurfurstendamm. Very helpful English speaking front desk staff and friendly chamber maids. Breakfast can be included in room rate if requested when booking. Breakfast staff friendly and efficient. Good selection of food choices on breakfast buffet. Single room was small but well appointed with good closet space. Shower but no bath. Refrigerated mini-bar. Couch and desk with PC and free high speed internet access. High speed internet is a priority for me as I take along Vonage and like the convenience of being able to have my phone connection wherever I travel. Hotel can provide limited number of day passes for S-Bahn, U-Bahn at about 4 Euro. Underground parking available at comparable price to other nearby locations. Overall, excellent value for price !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless!”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights over the new year period. It is located in the K'Damm area of Berlin which is quite a posh area and easy to get on to the public transport network. The nearest underground station is savignyplatz but in practice you will find it easier to reach uhlandstrabe as it gets you to more places quicker. Checking in was easy and I was soon in my room. I was mainly attracted to this hotel because of the free internet and it worked superbly - be aware though that it is not wireless so your device will need an ethernet port. Don't despair if it hasn't as each room comes with a PC anyway - never seen this before! The room I had was a single room and was quite small but very well presented with mini bar and modern bathroom. Checking out was easy and the hotel even allowed me to pay in British Pounds - very easy! I paid £220 for three nights in a standard single room. Overall, very pleasant made all the more novel by free internet and PC in every room. Would I stay here again, yes, without a doubt. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona2326
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gates Hotel for 3 nights for Berlin sightseeing and had a very enjoyable stay. The standard of the room was excellent, very clean, tidy and modern. Wonderful to have a laptop in the room - handy for checking out local info. Fabulous large bathroom, smartly finished and although no bathtub, it had a separate walk in shower area which was fantastic. Breakfast was very tasty and plentiful in selection. Also it was available till 10.30am, which, when you are on holiday is great not to be having to set the alarm for breakfast!! We also had a balcony in our room - very unusual, its probably been an old building. Its not exactly "room with a view" but what else would you expect right in the middle of a city. Its a great location for seeing Berlin, the U-bahn 2 mins walk away and from there you can go anywhere in the city. We loved Berlin, so much to see and do, the people so friendly and eating and drinking out very cheap and good quality. We will most definitely return to Berlin in the future and would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar with an asterisk”
Reviews.Author: rcepuch
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because they advertised PCs in every room and free Internet access. That sounded terrific, because I was in the middle of a long trip and needed to be able to catch up on messages without spending too much time and money in a smoky Internet café. Unfortunately, the Gates' Internet connection died on Sunday morning and wasn't fixed by the time I checked out a day later – very disappointing, considering how much emphasis the hotel put on it in their advertising! The room was very large and comfortable, and the hotel's in a quiet location not far from the Zoo Station (which is, of course, no longer the main station and not quite the lively area it once was).

Reviews.Title: “the standart by which i judge all others”
Reviews.Author: kimbaparisnyc
Reviews.Content: i am writing this a couple of years after i stayed here because i value other people's reviews so much. i travel frequently these days and i have yet to stay in a hotel that is as clean and pleasant as the gates hotel. i usually stay in hotels in the 3-4 star range although that doesn't really say much giving he range of quality among starred hotes. but the gates sparkled. and the service was very good. it is in the west of berlin which isn't the hot spot that mitte in the east is( although there are still plenty of nice cafes, patisseries and restaraunts nearby), but i would gladly give up that sort of convenience for a comfortable clean hotel, and the internet access can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnboy007
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel to stay in as other people have said. We loved the free use of computers in our room. the room was comfertable and very clean. the breakfast was brilliant with plenty of choice. The bar was very reasonable for drinks prices compared to other hotels. The reception staff were very friendly and helpfull there are many places to eat with in a short walking distance. we ate at the greek resturant and the food was lovely with good service. The hotel is very close to underground and 10-15 mins from maim railway station. we will be staying he again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & modern - laptop & broadband included!”
Reviews.Author: spuckle
Reviews.Content: Just back from a brilliant long weekend at Hotel Gates am Ku'damm - (--). The location is great on a quiet street, and getting around the city is easy as it's very close to Ernst-Reuter-Platz underground station which is only one stop on the U2 line from Zoo Station. The room was clean & modern, great bathroom with fab shower - always hot & powerful. Most impressive was the free in-room laptop with broadband access - great to check out restaurants/train times etc. Add the breakfast - you might think it's a bit pricey but there's a massive buffet with everything you could possibly want - with both Continental and hot breakfasts - there even seems always to be an hot oriental breakfast option! Fabulous places to eat and drink within short walking distance: the cafe just down the road on the corner Knesebeckstrasse/Goethestrasse sells great sandwiches. The Indian restaurant a few doors up on Knesebeckstr is brilliant. Mar y Sol restaurant, also on Knesebeckstr at Savignyplatz, serves great Spanish tapas. The Eldorado restaurant on the Ku'damm just down from the junction with Knesebeckstr does great steaks - even better than Blockhouse. I have to agree with a previous post that Berlin is a must-see city and the Gates is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well run Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kentish-Steve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last week. We did our research into various hotels and this one, despite a couple of complaints, seemed fairly good so we went ahead and booked. We were not disappointed. Contrary to a couple of reviews, we found the staff on the front desk to be diligent and friendly, (my German is schoolboy stuff but passable, their English was excellent). The rooms were spotless and cleaned every day and apart from the odd person walking across the courtyard at night, it was pretty much as peaceful as you'd want. The location is fabulous: 500 metres from the Ku'Damm, 100 metres from the nearest U-Bahn "Ernst Reuter Platz," 200 metres to the nearest S-Bahn "Sauvignyplatz" and a mere stone's throw to the nearest restaurants (which ranged from the homely and inexpensive to the more pricy ones) We tried hard to think of any negative things to say about the Gates, and can only think of two: 1. Being Brits we love a morning cup of tea, but this facility, so common in most European hotels, was not available in the room. There is a coffee house 50 metres away, so it's not like you can't get an early morning drink. 2. We were here in Spring and the weather was just turning pleasantly warm, and a large opening window was a nice touch in these days of sealed units and aircon, but I feel that in July and August, when the weather gets a lot hotter, aircon would be a bonus to be savoured. There you go, two very minor points, not even worth calling complaints really. We've stayed in hotels across Europe and paid more for a lot worse, and we both agreed that this was without doubt the best deal we've ever had. Booked through Expedia, flights and accommodation for 4 nights came to a touch under £200 each flying from London. Excellent value for money, and made all that much better by having such a comfortable, well-run hotel to base ourselves. We'd definitely reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Got a great deal on expedia 93 Cdn plus tax. (No breakfast) Free in room internet, with either their computer or your laptop. This seems to be a rarity in Europe where they like ripping you off for in-room internet. Bed very comfortable. They didn't do the two twins pushed together to make a bigger bed trick. Very quiet place. Near both S and U Bahn. Nice West Berlin neighborhood. Good hotel courtyard. Didn't eat there, but hotel eateries are usually a gyp anyway. Would stay there again. I had a slightly awkward door, often had to shove it open.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: yptee
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for one night. Due to the delay of my departing flight in Dublin, I missed my connecting flight in Frankfurt, as a result of that, I arrived in the hotel about 7 pm intead of 6 pm that I advised the hotel. To my horror, the hotel gave my room away because I turned up one hour late. They tried to get me to pay extra (a lot more) for an upgrade to a suite which I refused. This, in my opinion, is very bad practice. Finally, they agree to put me into a hotel nearly (I had to carry my luggage and find the hotel myself). The second hotel was a great hotel, even though it has the same star rating, it is a cheaper hotel. Obviously I could not get any refunds, so I couldn't help to feel that I have been robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this incredible hotel in Berlin. This hotel is worth twice the price they charge. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very large and comfortable, with lux bathroom (had a regular shower and a waterfall style shower), and the room had a balcony. It was quite and clean (clean by German standards, so it was exceptionally clean by American standards). The location is also very good, a quite street two blocks to subway and a ten minute walk to the main West train station, Bahnhof Zoo. I travel quite a bit for work and this was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Don't think twice, book this hotel now!

Reviews.Title: “The Gates is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Berlin at the end of 7 weeks travelling and found the Gates to be the best of any of the 18 hotels visited (including Hiltons and assorted 4 star establishments). The hotel is stylish and the staff were friendly and accomodating. My room was huge, the bed was supremely comfortable, the bathroom clean and well equiped and the 24/7 free internet access allowed me to check out all that Berlin had to offer, book onward rail journeys and keep up with work and friends in the comfort of my room. The hotel is close to the U-bahn (only 1 stop from the main station), a short walk from great shopping and the associated restaurant across the road offers delicious food served with flair and charm. All round The Gates is a real winner.
